articles.title: Throat spray, oral drug for malaria-arthritis effective in reducing spread of COVID-19: Singapore study - Economic Times
articles.description: The findings were made based on a large-scale clinical trial conducted last May, involving more than 3,000 migrant workers living in Tuas South Dormitory in the Industrial District of Singapore, Channel News Asia reported.
articles.content: An antiseptic throat spray and an oral drug usually prescribed to treat malaria and arthritis have been found to effectively reduce the spread of COVID-19 in high-transmission settings, researchers i… [+3843 chars]

articles.title: After a 7-month lockdown in Asia, this Toronto woman continued her trip around the world - CBC.ca
articles.description: Toronto woman Rebecca Hall had a year-long solo trip around the world planned for 2020. She left for that trip before the pandemic started, and after being stuck in a seven-month lockdown in Asia, she made the decision to keep going. Talia Ricci spoke with he…

articles.title: Singapore's Cabinet reshuffle: Chan Chun Sing, Ong Ye Kung and Lawrence Wong are firmly in the running for PM role, say observers - AsiaOne

articles.title: Iconic McDonald's outlet in Ridout Tea Garden to shut in December after 32 years in operation - AsiaOne
